page.title: 18TOURISM ST NEOT'S WELL
page.content: The well is about a quarter of a mile west of the church,in Milltown fields,and may be reached by a lane close to the corner of the St Neot garage.Very many years ago the garage was an inn.About the same time there was an ancient arch of stone over the well with doors to the entrance.About the year 1762 a large and spreading oak grew on the bank above.It was of a fan like shape and had probably been allowed to grow untouched for centuries.It was however cut down by a tenant for building purposes.The well was restored by Captain Charles Gerveys Grylls,in 1852.People believed that the well had strange powers and people came from as far away as Exeter to bathe their children in the waters of the well on the first three mornings in May.
